title: 107_hr3676
content: The Act titled "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Tobacco Use Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" amends the Medicare program to include coverage for counseling for tobacco cessation. This includes defining counseling for cessation of tobacco use as a covered service under the Social Security Act. The Medicare program now covers counseling for cessation of tobacco use, which includes diagnostic, therapy, and counseling services for individuals using tobacco products. Services must be provided by a physician or other authorized healthcare professional following clinical practice guidelines. The Medicare program covers counseling for tobacco cessation, including diagnostic, therapy, and counseling services, following clinical practice guidelines. Payment for these services is at 100 percent of the actual charge or a fee schedule determined by the Secretary, with the elimination of coinsurance and deductible. The Medicare program covers counseling for tobacco cessation without coinsurance or deductible. Amendments to the Act specify that the deductible shall not apply to counseling for tobacco cessation in outpatient hospital settings. Effective date for these changes is January 1 of the first calendar year that begins at least 6 months after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. COVERAGE OF COUNSELING FOR CESSATION OF TOBACCO USE UNDER THE MEDICAID PROGRAM. The Medicaid program is being amended to include coverage for tobacco use cessation medications and counseling for pregnant women, with the removal of cost-sharing for counseling services. The Medicaid program is amended to cover tobacco use cessation counseling and medications for pregnant women, with the removal of cost-sharing for counseling services. The effective date for these amendments is January 1 of the first calendar year that begins at least 6 months after the enactment of the Act. Promoting cessation of tobacco use under the maternal and child health program includes counseling, medications, and antitobacco messages as part of quality services. The amendment will take effect upon the enactment of the Act.
